website_summaries.verdict: Multiple sizes means there's a Baskerville muzzle for all breeds.
pros: Excellent ventilation, and a very secure fit
Rubber cage more comfortable than metal
Can be attached to collars and leashes
cons: Difficult to find the right size
Stronger breeds can break cage within minutes

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a very skittish lab mix, so taking him on walks and to the vet can be a challenge. After buying this muzzle, it makes my life so much more easier knowing he can't harm any strangers. It took about a day for him to get used to it and lots of treats but he's acclimated well to the muzzle. It's definitely durable, and well worth the money :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We got the largest size and it's perfect. He has enough room to bark
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd got used to this muzzle in a day. We got the largest size and it's perfect. He has enough room to bark, pant and stick his nose in the snow. It's light and pretty easy to put on. We took off the strap that goes over the top of his head as it doesn't seem necessary and slides to the side, and just kept the muzzle attached to his usual collar, so that it's easy to put both on at the same time when he leaves the house. It's unfortunate our dog needs a muzzle but for now, it's a good way to prevent him from getting too protective around strangers.
customer_reviews.author: Alina

customer_reviews.title: Okaaaay, but one issue
customer_reviews.text: The product works well, but it's edges seem to be tooo sharp. I ordered a size 4 for my German shepherd pup and all seems to fit very well, but after just a third time use it began to cut her nose. I'm including a photo to show the problem area. Debating on ordering a size 5 or will it be too big?? Other than that it's great for panting, and drinking water while it's on.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Auquilla

customer_reviews.title: does the job but chafes the muzzle.
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done by staying on the pup's face even when they are trying to pull it off. And it is open so the dog can drink water and take treats through the cage. The cage has some sharp points on the inside that caused chafing and bleeding on my dog's muzzle. I fixed this by using a knife to whittle down the sharp spots and gluing some craft foam to the insides of the cage to provide comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great muzzle: make sure to properly condition your dog to wear this!
customer_reviews.text: I love this muzzle. I strongly believe every dog should be muzzle trained, and these are great. It is so important to make sure that dogs learn to LOVE their muzzle BEFORE they need them, and this is flexible, comfortable and easy to feed through.
customer_reviews.author: ChelseaK

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Read reviews first! Serious Chaffing
customer_reviews.text: Don’t Buy!!! I received this and it fit perfectly with enough room for my pit to open her mouth to drink. I got a size 4 because it said size up one. The 3 was her measurements. When I opened it I thought hmmmm where’s the padding that the description says “neoprene padding?” After the first hour of her wearing it we noticed chaffing under her chin. The second time she bleed. After combing thoroughly through reviews, which I wish I had done before, a lot of other dogs had the same issue. Until they come up with a solution I’m not using this!!
customer_reviews.author: Tash_dreamer

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this product on the recommendation of our dog ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on the recommendation of our dog trainer. The first one I bought broke after the third day of use and the second one broke the first day we got it. We have a red heeler and yes he’s powerful, but I would not expect him to break two of these so quickly. He is breaking the area where the straps connect to the rubber muzzles. Each muzzle broke in a separate area, so I cannot say it’s just one weak spot in the design. We have now moved on to a leather muzzle, which is more expensive, but we have no issues with the durability.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Greatest muzzel I have ever found.
customer_reviews.text: Looks a bit clunky, but performs like no other. My dog can eat, drink, and pant while wearing this muzzel. She is a great dane weighing well over 100 pounds though not a year old yet. She has not succeeded in damaging it, and cannot remove it. She is not stressed wearing it and readily plays and relaxes, frequently sleeping. I keep livestock which she attacks and injures if not leashed or muzzeled. This allows her to accompany me around them without posing a threat to their safety. Highly recommend this muzzel. It may not be beautiful, but it works and she is comfortable wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my dog because he will attack any dog that comes near him and I don't want any dog injured. The problem is that this is soft, pliable rubber. My dog took it off within 30 seconds, all the while I was pulling on his leash and yelling at him to stop. He simply put a paw under the bottom and pulled. The rubber flexed and off it came. Over and over again. It was completely worthless. I could not tighten it enough to stop him fom removing it. Don't get a false sense of security by trusting this muzzle. It does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Tombstone Luke

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart unhelpful
customer_reviews.text: I measured my dogs muzzle and head several times to make sure I ordered the right size. I received the muzzle and even tightening it completely it is way too big. The instructions were also unclear and I had to Google it because I couldn't figure out where the clip went. Luckily my dog was patient but he was able to get it off in less than 30 seconds. I highly suggest sizing down or buying another brand because this will not protect anything.
customer_reviews.author: Leeann Warren

customer_reviews.title: Works fine now, but we our dog should not have ...
customer_reviews.text: This gave my dog blisters so we had to put it in boiling water and adjust it for his face. Works fine now, but we our dog should not have had to suffer from having blisters on his face and we should not have had to make adjustments to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: I had high hopes
customer_reviews.text: I'm not gonna lie, I was and still am very frustrated with my Border Collie. He has been biting and destroying everything and will get every muzzle off his head and destroy every crate he is put in. When I got this, I had to do some minor reinforcing because my dog got it off within minutes (much longer than other muzzles). After the reinforcing, the muzzles stayed on for 45 minutes that I left to get lunch... then I left to a meeting for about 2.5 hours and came back to this picture... the anti bite durable muzzle has been chewed up.
customer_reviews.author: Jia Jian Tin

customer_reviews.title: The best inexpensive muzzle
customer_reviews.text: This is the only muzzle my dog will tolerate. I have a mastiff/pitbull mix, she’s a rescue and she has fear aggression toward other dogs. I got this to try to work with her and socialize her. She has always immediately tried to get other muzzles off and pawed at them constantly. I used treats to introduce this one to her and it’s going a lot better. Even when she has tried to paw at it to get it off it’s very secure especially when you use the collar loop. Love that she can still take treats through it too!
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: Follow the rules and this will change your life!
customer_reviews.text: This works so well. We followed the acclimation rules by putting peanut butter in and slowly getting our great dane mix used to it. Now, she's excited to put it on, and she's able to be around our other dog without us worrying. They'd been fighting, and since she is so much larger, we felt this was a great way to keep them both comfortable when they're together. So far, so good! She can eat, bark, drink water and get treats, but we do not keep it on her for long periods. All in all, it's been a life-changer for our household!!
customer_reviews.author: PheePhyPhoPhum

customer_reviews.title: Size Chart is Off
customer_reviews.text: Well I'm giving one star because according to the size chart I ordered a size 6. I have no idea what kind of akita is this large lol but it's way too big even for my largest akita. So I will update my review once I get the right size
customer_reviews.author: Kiara Styers

customer_reviews.title: Worked but wish they were more comfy for the dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for muzzle training. I wish they had some sort of padding for the nose area, it rubbed the skin/fur raw on his muzzle. It was only on him for an hour. other than that they worked very well and they could not remove it. I also saw both of them drink water while wearing them, but they weren't comfortable enough to eat with them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Traci M. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Pro Dog Trainers Number 1 Choice
customer_reviews.text: As a professional dog trainer, Baskerville Ultra Muzzles are the ONLY brand/type I can trust, when working with aggressive dogs with known bite history. This muzzle allows easy ability for dogs to pant freely, drink water, receive treats, etc., without being able to bite.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: If you must use a muzzle, this one is the best!
customer_reviews.text: My dog has to wear a muzzle in public, and I bought him several basket types that ranged from $60-90 and they were all junk! The baskets are too heavy and restrictive, and he refused to wear them. Then...I came across this one for less than $20 and it's great! This muzzle allows his nose to fit through the opening making it feel less restrictive. It's not bulky and heavy like the baskets, and I don't feel so bad making him wear it since he has plenty of room to pant, drink and eat snacks. If you want something lightweight, and not too restrictive...look no further- this is the muzzle to get!
customer_reviews.author: BigDawgy

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: This product was awesome...... I got it because my dog doesn't do too well at the Vet and the one they use at the vet is hard to put on. I trained with my dog before going to the vet. Did the Recomended cream cheese inside with treats. Started with a few minutes a day and then when I finally went to the vet it worked...... Now because I didn't want to risk it being easy to remove I did use his collar and the top fastener. But my dog was quite comfortable....the key is training and when you use it putting the cream cheese or peanut butter inside will make it easier
customer_reviews.author: genesis aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Worthless product that doesn’t stay on if you even get it on...
customer_reviews.text: It’s awful. My dog laughed at me, as she took her paw up on her head and slid it right off. I even tried to tie it to her collar and then it was just hanging off her collar. Absolutely pointless. Not only is it impossible to get on a flailing dog, when you FINALLY get it on.... they slide it right off unless they are the dumbest dog ever... If you have any sort of dog that hasn’t had its spirit broken it’s going to pull it right off. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Alanna

customer_reviews.title: NO RETURN POLICY!
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you know the exact size! This company DOES NOT TAKE RETURNS! Also, this is made out of rubber that is not very flexible. It was too big for our dog and there was no making it work. Very disappointed that something like this would have a no return policy. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Beth K.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I ordered another size 2 since I had just lost the one that I had for my dog. I bought the first one a few years ago. The design of the muzzle has been changed, and not for the better. It did not fit as well on the same dog, kept slipping off to the side, and jamming him under his eyes. There was a discharge from his eyes. I did readjust the new muzzle several times but it was impossible to get it to fit the way the size fit that I purchased several years ago. I bought a different muzzle that works.
customer_reviews.author: kllsty

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by our trainer- dogs find them comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by our trainer. The dogs took right to them. I was a bit shocked. It took almost zero time for them to feel comfortable with them. I got the brown one because we have a german shepherd and I didn't want them to look like they were vicious dogs. And in the brown, they don't. I went by the sizing chart and the chart wasn't accurate for us. We had to exchange them for a larger size. But the company was super awesome and easy to exchange. We got them really quick. Easy to adjust and use.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my dog that tries to eat toads
customer_reviews.text: I found it a bit hard to find the perfect size for my mixed breed dog, and after exchanging size 4 for size 3, I am very pleased. I got this so that I can walk my dog without worrying about him eating toads and trash off the ground. The gaps on the front of the muzzle are a bit larger than I wanted and he might be able to lick something undesirable, but he definitely won’t be able to chomp down on anything unwanted now. It’s also very sturdy and seems to be comfortable for him.
customer_reviews.author: Lidia

customer_reviews.title: They are virtually impossible to remove for dogs if properly fit and getting the right fit is very easy. They even work for shor
customer_reviews.text: This is honestly the only muzzle anyone should ever use. I'm a dog trainer and I work with highly aggressive dogs. I've been attacked by several dogs that have been wearing these muzzles as protection for me and would likely be dead if it wasn't for these muzzles. They are virtually impossible to remove for dogs if properly fit and getting the right fit is very easy. They even work for shorter muzzle breeds like pugs, Bulldogs and boxers. The company of animals does it again and has provided an excellent product that exceeded my standards.
customer_reviews.author: Clive

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. Collar loop should be wider.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. One complaint - the loop for the collar is pretty small. The buckle on the collar I have for my dog won't fit through the loop on the muzzle. because of that, the dog is able to slip the muzzle over her head if she hooks it on something and backs up. My dog is a 35lb heeler mutt with a tiny little peanut head and it works pretty well for her (size 3, see pic). She can pant, drink and you can feed her (but she really can't eat with it on.
customer_reviews.author: ATXexas

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size bigger.
customer_reviews.text: The muzzle ran way too small, in a way that I actually feel bad when I put it on my dog. I measured his snout circumfrence to be 12 inches and his length to be 3.5. The length is perfect but the circumference is just way too small. I got my pit a size 4, but clearly needed a 5 or even 6. Also the bottom loop won't fit his collar since the clip is too wide to go through; so I pretty much wasted my time buying this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amra

customer_reviews.title: Dog hates it, but I love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my pitbull. People tend to get a little scared when she's around because she has animal aggression. With the muzzle on, she looks crazy like Hannibal Lector. We did all the measurements and everything fits perfectly. The cage is made of tough material and should last a while for my needs. She's able to open her mouth enough to lick and drink water. She's not used to having something strapped to her head and it bothers her. Her playful temperament immediately changes to submissive. When I remove the muzzle, standby though because she runs around all crazy with excitement.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony E.

customer_reviews.title: TOTALLY WASTE OF MONEY & TIME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed ! Even a dumb dog would remove this muzzle !! I have tested 2 of this with my 5 months old dogs and at the beginning they look so good and secure , they fit perfectly and they were secured attached, after 1 hour test I came back just to find my freaking ninja Houdini dogs laughing in my face ! Muzzles destroyed. ! I won’t recommend this product , it looks strong but dogs destroy it like a piece of paper.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo Mamalon

customer_reviews.title: Best muzzle I’ve tried
customer_reviews.text: This is the third muzzle I’ve tried for my dog. Others were too flimsy or didn’t fit properly. This is a very well made muzzle and is much more secure than others. There’s two backup features that help prevent your dog from slipping it off — and issue I had with other muzzles. You actually buckle the strap to secure it onto your dog, and there’s a loop you can put the collar through. It seems much more comfortable for the dog and it actually allows him to fully pant. I’m very pleased with this one! I can trust it to work when bringing my unpredictable dog around strangers.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Fit my pit
customer_reviews.text: We for this because my put got extreemly protective over our house/property while I waa pregnant and would be very aggressive when people would come to our gate. So we put this on her when we had newer people around and she calmed down. It was like she knew we wanted her to stop and so she did. However it was real long on her nose, but fit around her big nose, head, and neck. Her nick name is big head, and it fit her. It eventually got chewed up by a pit when I loaned it out to my sister. Its durable on a dog, but nothing is indestructible to a pit
customer_reviews.author: K Rose.

customer_reviews.title: SO FAR SO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrong size at first but quickly got it exchanged with no issue to the right size (within a matter of two days). My pup was not happy but couldn't get out of it and it fit perfectly. He could still drink water/ pant and sniff everything but no more chewing on furniture!! :) Ive tried the bitter spray but he doesn't mind the taste and chewed through anything anyways and the vet said he is past the chewing stage so apparently he just likes to eat furniture. At least with this i know he will be safe from ingesting things he shouldn't while im at work.
customer_reviews.author: JOVIE

customer_reviews.title: Every dog owner should have one
customer_reviews.text: I bought these muzzles for my dogs on the advice of the SPCA. Other reviewers on Amazon mentioned using them for vet visits, so I tried it. I'm so glad I did because vet visits are much less stressful when the dog is muzzled. I urge all dog owners to muzzle their dogs for vet visits, especially if the dog is injured. The muzzle is cheap, it doesn't hurt your dog, and it keeps people and animals safe. I am grateful to the man who invented this muzzle, the SPCA for putting it on their website, and other reviewers for advising dog owners to use muzzles for vet visits. Thank you all very much.
customer_reviews.author: Rose City

customer_reviews.title: Bulky but no pant room
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on my Chesapeake Bay Retriever in size 5 and its too small, not enough room for panting and narrow so it rubs on the side of his face. Of course it works for short durations but not good if he were to get hot or exhaust himself cuz he can’t fully open his mouth to pant. The rubber basket is really thick and bulky looking though so sizing up would probably look hideous, so I’ll probably go with a different style of muzzle next, maybe leather or biothane.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this product.  IT WAS NOT SAFE FOR ME TO USE
customer_reviews.text: They use straps for adjustments. The adjusters for the straps are not holding. Twice they came loose and my dog came out of the muzzle. I'm going to start searching for muzzles with buckles. I purchased this for safety, I don't want to see my dog get hurt or hurt another dog, sorry, this product isn't working for me. I purchased a leather muzzle with buckles that hold the adjusting straps in place. Using this Baskerville muzzle put me at risk and it's a liability
customer_reviews.author: rkstone

customer_reviews.title: Spent a good hour for my search
customer_reviews.text: I have a oversized purebred German. Shepherd. His snout length is 5inches and circumference is almost 11 inches. A lot of people have asked me if he is mixed because of how long his snout is. I did not understand why until I started looking for a basket muzzle for him. He bites and licks himself so much that its harming him. I spent a good hour looking at many stores online when I finally found this one. Its long enough for my dog but the circumference of the muzzle has so much room. I wish there was a company that specialized in making basket muzzle for dog with long thin snouts.
customer_reviews.author: Takugo^-^

customer_reviews.title: I trust the brand
customer_reviews.text: When muzzle training it is important to do it RIGHT and not to wait until you need to muzzle your dog to use it. All my foster dogs are muzzle trained and learn quickly that muzzle = treats and it's a trust and bonding exercise for us. I really like the basket/cage muzzles for dogs because they can drink, pant, take treats, etc. and they put me at ease knowing that I can take my fosters (dogs I do not know) anywhere and not worry about them getting a bite history because of an off leash dog or their own reactivity. Vets also really appreciate it!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Professional Trainer's Recommended Muzzle
customer_reviews.text: I am a certified professional dog trainer (CPDT-KA) and this is my recommended muzzle. It is also the recommended muzzle for my colleagues, including those that specialize in aggression cases. It's hard rubber so relatively light and comfortable for the dog to wear. They are able to eat and drink through it, open and close their mouth, and you are able to deliver food rewards relatively easily. Whatever you're reason for using a muzzle, this is a great option. Just remember to make sure you have the proper fit and that your dog is always supervised when muzzled.
customer_reviews.author: Kait Seyal

customer_reviews.title: The antidote to the $3,000 tennis ball
customer_reviews.text: At the age of 6, our lab/golden decided to completely consume a tennis ball. Cost: Fear Pain Suffering Surgery Weeks of recovery and round the clock small meals $3,000.00 Got this muzzle. It fits perfectly, lets our dog take small treats, pant, drink water--but prevents tennis-ball (and other off-label) consumption. He adjusted instantly b/c he only gets his off-leash freedom and special treats when wearing the mask. Mask = fun. Cost: $13.00 Guess which one I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LoveFactually author

customer_reviews.title: Made for security, not comfort. Was able to get full refund.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: changed my star rating from 2 stars to 4 stars, based upon the quick and no-hassle return/refund. That’s definitely helpful. Cons: Big, heavy, bulky. Looks extremely uncomfortable. Pros: If you can get your dog to wear it, it will definitely serve it’s intended purpose. It’s sturdy and secure, just like a medieval torture device. I try to share my product experience to help other shoppers save time and money. If I was able to help answer some of your questions, please let me know by marking this review as helpful. I use your feedback to write other helpful reviews. Happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Red, RN

customer_reviews.title: Bulky, Heavy, Very Large/Awkward.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something like this for my dog after he had a huge allergy episode and scratched himself badly. This was way too heavy, bulky and unforgiving. I ordered the size according to the charts/measurements recommended—still far too large and very awkward trying to put it on my poor doggo’s face. However, it did seem very durable. Still... Returned this item due to its irrelevance and ridiculous weight. This was my one and only attempt to try a muzzle for his condition. I continue to stick with E-Collars/Cones to this day.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest CraftyLass

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Lab who is a terror at the vet. I tried it out for the first time last week and no matter how tight I put it, she pulls it off within seconds. I did purchase the correct size. I wish I could get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Nannerama2020

customer_reviews.title: Measurement chart not all that accurate for this design.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be more appropriate in design for a shorter snout dogs such as a Rottweiler. I measured our 123lb German Shepard and the measurements fell into the size 6 recommendation by s half inch. When fitted, it was way too wide and floppy yet the length as fine, if not short. We ordered the next size down (5) and it works better yet has a very short snout which could easily fail if the dog becomes aggressive. Comfort seems to be excellent which is surprising. I hope they continue to improve on this product and offer more size variations.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The product I got wasn't the same as what is in the picture. The picture is the original product but it has been "updated" and the updates make it not as effective as the original. I returned it and found the original style at a pet store.
customer_reviews.author: JJones1201

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: We have a 110# German Shepherd. He is a big boy. My vet recently had an issue with another dog and asked me if I would get this muzzle specifically. I obliged even though he looks menacing he is a cream puff. Although, I figure this would protect him as much as the vet staff. I was bad and never trained him on it prior to using it. He took to it in only a few minutes with some encouragement. The vet ended up having to keep him overnight. No rub marks, no trauma. He can drink with it on as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Not if you’re dog is Houdini...
customer_reviews.text: 175# Dane, 20 months old. Could not, can not be left alone with it on. It’s the right size, but to prevent him from pulling it off with his paws it would need to be uncomfortably tight. I’m sure it would work fine while in public on a leash, but that’s not why I bought it. Zero stars for my intended use, but to be fair gave 3 as likely fine when on a leash. I think you should remove the idea as use as preventative measure from chewing.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & Sandra

customer_reviews.title: READ THIS BEFORE YOU BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The material used to make this muzzle is decent quality. BUT...... there needs to be padding where the muzzle meets the upper bridge of their snout, by their eyes. I've seen some pretty bad pictures on here, of dogs with rashes and raw spots, because it just rubs and rubs. Also, the size chart picture sucks. I have a male American Akita, a big one at that. He's 143lbs. I got the size 6, since that's what the picture says to get for Akitas. This thing was massive. Looks like it belongs on a horse. Sending it back and getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and sturdy muzzle
customer_reviews.text: We have adopted dogs that don't do well with strangers due past injustices. This means, to prevent any chance of biting--we muzzle. We,also, have a big Coonhound that barks in the most deafening tones,particularly since he doesn't like the Vets office. Thus, we use the muzzle to keep the bark sound lowered. We've tried many types in the past but this us a winner. The material is so sturdy unlike mesh that can rip easily with a nail. It's comfy so the dog can drink and pant. I'd suggest the security of this product to any dog owner that has a large breed and fears biting.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Sheets

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind my GSDs are safely behaving
customer_reviews.text: Have 3 GSDs (Sig - 102 lbs male, Sauer - 75 lbs female & Kimber - 65 lbs female). Sauer likes to play rough and the Kimber likes to test Sig the true alpha (but just wants to be left alone) male. Well, now they are all back in order until some point (few more days) when they transition to e-collars and finally (no e-collars or muzzles) be a happy pack! Till then, it's 24-7 training (with plenty of good boy & good girls - encouragement)! It's an on-going life style with very intelligent, very protective & very loyal GSDs.
customer_reviews.author: Turtle/Bisugo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!  Very Well Made!
customer_reviews.text: Not that ANY dog "likes" wearing a muzzle, but as far as muzzle designs go, this is a winner. Unlike a lot of muzzle designs that force a dogs mouth shut, this design actually lets your dog open his mouth like normal--there's just a cage around it prevent him or her from actually "using" it on someone or something. I haven't worn it myself 😆 but it looks to be form fitting and comfortable for the ol' boy, so if you're in the market, I wouldn't hesitate to give this muzzle a try!
customer_reviews.author: Ben A

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to do muzzle training with your dog, this is a great muzzle. It is sturdy, open for easy breathing, easy to clean, and easy to put on. I use mine for helicopter training but it can also be used for dog aggression or if your dog was injured they may not want someone touching them so this will keep all safe. HINT: when training a dog to wear a muzzle start by adding peanut butter to the inside and let you dog out their face in the muzzle. After a while they won’t mind wearing it.
customer_reviews.author: Nanci M

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for a muzzle
customer_reviews.text: Mostly good for what we need it for. This is much more spacious for our pup to wear when he is unsupervised. It has decreased his reckless chewing. It is sturdy and has held up well and remained attached despite our big boy's best efforts. However, it maybe be a little too spacious- he still can chew on the edge of things through the larger gaps in the muzzle. Also the strap on the top center never sits correctly no matter how wr adjust it and sometimes veers off to the side and into the poor dog's eye.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great Muzzle
customer_reviews.text: This muzzle works great. All the other ones I've tried have been too uncomfortable for my dog and he would constantly try to rip them off. This one doesn't seem to bother him at all because he has never tried to get it off. It also has enough straps on it that if your dog were to try to get it off, it would be nearly impossible. The cage also allows the dog to pant and breathe freely, but that means that they can also bark so do not get this muzzle if you intend to use it as an anti-bark tool.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've just started muzzle training my dog due to there being so many tiny loose dogs in my neighborhood all of a sudden. My dog does not like random dogs running up to her (I don't either!). The fit looks good, though I think I will eventually get one with more pant room. I like that you can take the forehead strap off and that the basket can be adjusted (leave it in warm water and it becomes pliable, then put in cold water to set it again). No issues with giving her treats with it on.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Too uncomfortable for dog
customer_reviews.text: This is not a comfortable muzzle for my dog. The straps are soft but the actual muzzle part is a very hard plastic and they put no type of padding on the inside where it rests on her muzzle. A simple solution we thought of was to stick a furniture foot pad (padded felt) on the inside so that the weight of the basket wasn’t directly against the bone of her muzzle. It sucks to put one of these on a dog in the first place the very least they could do is provide some comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Works - Keeps dog from eating stuff on walks
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that it would fit properly since my dogs nose measurements did not really fit the sizes available. I needed 3.5inches long and 10" circumference. I ordered size 3 and it fit. I like to walk with my dog without a leash and sometimes he will eat coyote or deer poop or other things before I can get to him. This muzzle works. He does not like to wear it but once on a walk, his desire to walk keeps him from thinking about it. Muzzle allows his mouth to be open for panting but best part... he can't pick up anything to eat.
customer_reviews.author: JoMama

customer_reviews.title: Baskerville - Plastic Muzzle - Work in Progress
customer_reviews.text: This muzzle is a harder plastic than I expected. The straps are adjustable and the plastic buckle has a little sliding lock that I didn't realize it had and couldn't get it off of my dog the first time I clipped it on. :( Our dog isn't used to it yet but we are working on it by just getting him to stick his nose in it with a treat being held at the end of the muzzle. We will also try putting peanut butter at the end to get his focus on the PB and not the muzzle.
customer_reviews.author: scooterjoey

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a dog that is distrustful of strangers, so I asked the rescue about getting a muzzle for him in case he needed to be taken to the vet. They recommended this one because the dog can drink, pant and take treats with it on. I used the muzzle on a trip to the vet and they were right. He did very well with it on, and I was able to give him treats during the vet exam. He is doing better with people and I doubt he will need the muzzle next time.
customer_reviews.author: olotsodogs

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty easy to put on, but I give it 3 stars for the sizing. I have a 70 lbs GSD mix (might be mixed with a chow and/or lab). Anyway, he has a pretty long but slender snout. We got him a size 4 at first but it was too tight around his snout. We ordered a size 5 afterwards and it was way too roomy. The size difference between a 4 and a 5 is pretty big.
customer_reviews.author: PiggyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Intimidating :(
customer_reviews.text: I knew it would make my precious adopted peaches look like a monster, but I needed something to keep her anxious self from attacking other dogs at my apartment complex. We had an incident where she seemed friendly towards another dog, but started lashing out and showing teeth within 6 seconds. I like that it's a full basket and heavy duty so she can't bite anyone else, but I don't really like how sharp some of the edges are. Might take some sandpaper to it maybe. She's definitely not liking it, and tries to take it off often, but it's better than her hurting another dog and someone trying to get her euthanized. 🙃
customer_reviews.author: Vannah

customer_reviews.title: When your dog is unruly...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for myself! I have avoided clipping my dogs toenails for too long because he hates having his toes touched. Frankly I was looking out for my own interest and safety! While this muzzle was a bit unwieldy and takes 2 of us to place on him, it did get the job done. If I had to use this for more than 10 minutes, I would want something more stable and easier to slip on and off. The dog gives this a poor rating, but I'd give it 3 stars because it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: The Best I've Found
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that this muzzle doesn't come off despite my dog's diligent efforts. Unfortunately it has to be tight enough that it presses into the end of his nose a bit, but as a Doberman with a significantly long snout I understand that he's the outlier. The only thing I don't like is the center strap doesn't stay put no matter how many different ways I adjust it and is always sliding over one of his eyes. Despite that, this is still the best muzzle I've found and have bought the same one twice.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Muzzle for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Our 110 LBS German Shepherd recently had surgery and future trips back to the Vet required me to purchase a muzzle—Jax no longer enjoyed his visits with the lady who operated on his foot. The muzzle worked great and I was able to control his head while the Vet gave him a shot to put him out so they could take out his stiches. An added benefit is, dogs can also drink water with the muzzle on. The Vet even remarked that it was a nice piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Presgrove

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: With proper training this is a great tool. I have an american bulldog boxer mix and got the size 4 and size 5. The size 5 gives pant room (this is important of wearing for more than a few minutes at a time.)but the 4 fits better in length which the narrow size is fine if using for something like nail trimming or brief vet visit. His mouth is too wide to reform the size 4 to allow more pant room. 1st image is the size 5. 2nd is the size 4. I use the 5 when out on walks or for a greater lenth of time.
customer_reviews.author: arsallotTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is not accurate, not well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these to train 1 year old dogs ( a boxer and a lab) to not chew things on a walk. The lab got his off within 5 minutes, the boxer we couldn't get it to fit no matter what we did, I bought according to her measurements, but in order to fit, it sits right at her eyes.. The strap going up over the head on both was installed twisted, Measurements do not correspond with what the size guide is! I ended up donating to a local bully breed rescue.
customer_reviews.author: JanisW

customer_reviews.title: All around wonderful product awesome craftsmanship gives peace of mind to guests peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Definitely an all-around wonderful product. I have a 150 lb Rottweiler that tends to get over-excited and likes to nibble when he's excited. I don't want guests coming over being terrified while a faint Rottweiler is running at them, because he is a big teddy bear & wouldn't even hurt a fly. I think with this mussel, it's doesn't make him look extra scary because of a mussel being on & will give guests peace of mind knowing that they have no chance in the world of getting nolde by my big teddy bear of a Rottweiler. Not that he's ferocious or anyting
customer_reviews.author: Michael Tavalese

customer_reviews.title: More comfortable than the mesh type. Not for aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.text: It's would probably be a great muzzle for those dogs that aren't aggressive chewers. In fairness it did the job for several months, it fit well, and my 70lb pit seemed to find it more comfortable than the cloth version. Unfortunately I have a very smart and aggressive chewer who pushed his face to the front and nibbled at the hard material until he opened the entire front. Came home to diapers and wipes strewn throughout the house (ironically it went pretty well with the Christmas decorations). Had to upgrade to a metal version he can't chew through.
customer_reviews.author: IrishPuterGeek

customer_reviews.title: Works, but wears..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this muzzle so I could more easily trim my Husky's toenails. It works, she's not able to bite through the harness or anything. I like that she can get her tongue out through the bottom for treats, etc. The only downside is that it definitely wears on their skin and if she had to wear it for any extended amount of time, she'd likely have bald spots around her nose. But we only use for trimmings, so it shouldn't be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Huge help for training a mouthy 1.5 yo maremma. Recommended to us by professional trainer.
customer_reviews.text: This device was suggested by a trainer who also works with humane society dogs. We adopted a 1.5yo maremma (huge livestock guardian dog) that is very mouthy and likes to use his teeth (gently) to play. Obviously this is a huge issue, big dogs that use teeth can be really scary. She suggested we keep this on him whenever introducing him to new people or during times that he would normally use his teeth to help re-train him to stop doing this. It's working and we have some relief from the intensity which means we have more energy for positive reward training.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bergeron

customer_reviews.title: Need collar to secure
customer_reviews.text: Sizing was a problem, and I wound up buying 3 different sizes to find the right fit. My usually docile runt decided to get scrappy at 10 years old. She is so scrappy she was able to get the muzzle off until I used a collar to secure it around her neck through the loop.. She is getting used to it and can even sleep with it on. Not the best design, but better than one of those hannibal lecter contraptions, and don't even bother with those vinyl velcro muzzles if you have a dog that suddenly decides to lose their mind.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Muzzle and Fit
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my foster dog. She is scared of new people and in order to reduce her and my anxiety while taking her into the animal clinic I bought this product. The fit was spot on. She can still pant, drink and take treats with it on. We did practice positive association with peanut butter so she could get used to it. She is a 20 lb beagle/chihuahua mix. I also like this tan color that matches her coat. You will need a narrow collar band in order to feed it through the muzzle loops and attach the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Zona

customer_reviews.title: Great choice in a muzzle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Hazel because she likes to chew. She is a hyper pitbul puppy who is a very big girl. If left alone for 5 minutes she will destroy things, such as the bottom of her vrate and any "indestructible" bed we might place in there for her comfort. We chose size 5, which may be a little large for her but the the size 4 would have been to small. It is super easy to put on her and she doesn't mind it too much. She can drink and recieve treats easily. We purchased this in order to help her claim down a little when out of her crate. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Tara Christie

customer_reviews.title: Good muzzle, weird sizing
customer_reviews.text: The sizes are weird...I measured and according to it I should get a size 3...from my lab mix. I decided to go with the suggested size 5 (for labs, etc). It fits, barely. I should have gone with a 4...but when cinched as tight as possible it will stay on so I kept it. She can drink water and bark but it prevents her from chewing up everything all night--which is our main purpose. So that's great!
customer_reviews.author: klchapm

customer_reviews.title: Best invention ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was so hesitant to purchase and put these muzzles (I have 2 coonhounds) on my dogs...but WOW! Not we can't live without them. My hounds can be unpredictable outside with other dogs & I wanted piece of mind when I walk them. These muzzles are simple to put on and they are very safe for the dogs to wear. My boys can drink and pant easily with them on. Best of all is knowing that they can't nip other dogs while on the trail. There was no "learning curve" for my dogs, they got used to them right away. Thanks for all of your reviews on this great product which encouraged me to buy two!
customer_reviews.author: Marla Meridith

customer_reviews.title: it's not really great for a kangal's head shape..
customer_reviews.text: I know it's a good muzzle,, was highly recommended,, just not for a kangal, or at least my kangal. it fits, but the largest sized one just barely seems roomy enough and mine isn't full grown yet. just a year old, my main issue is that it just sits up a little high and obstructs his vision. I definitely need a cage muzzle as he is stronger than most dogs. suppose I might have to get a jafco or some other brand. why is everything 3 steps more than I want it to be? lol.. if you have a kangal or Anatolian shepherd go with a different one, then let me know when you find one that fits nice
customer_reviews.author: sam

customer_reviews.title: SUPER easy for a dog to remove
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! We have 2 dogs that we purchased muzzles for, one is 100 lbs and one is 30 lbs. The brand came highly recommended by our trainer but simply did not work. Both dogs were able to very easily remove the muzzles in a matter of minutes with little effort. We had 2 adults and professional dog trainer fitting and securing them, and still every time they remove them quickly. The trainer said the design has changed, so maybe these used to work better but now they are worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M Cox

customer_reviews.title: Meets most dog muzzle needs
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a quality product that will meet most dog muzzle needs. The smallest size could stand some modifications. These are great for grooming dogs that will try to snap, and great for dogs who need to be muzzled for safety reasons. They can bark, eat, drink, and pant quite easily. I use these a lot for my profession and managing my own dogs and I recommend them to clients all the time. You can heat them up and mould them to fit fat faced dogs like my chow.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Bingham

customer_reviews.title: 3 for my Boxer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Boxer she’s 50lbs and was between the size of a 2 and 3. I went with a 3 because I was scared If the 2 would be to tight her measurements were 10.5 around the mouth but I felt it would be better to be looser. They do have shorter noses than other dogs so this is fine for now. Training tool so she can be socialized.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyne

customer_reviews.title: Great Muzzle for Introducing Aggressive Dogs to New Environments
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to us by a dog trainer. Our dog is not outright aggressive, but she is uncomfortable with people touching/petting her. This thing will stay on and it will NOT come off if you get the correct size. Our dog has tried multiple times to get it off and has always failed. She can still eat/drink with this on. Yeah, you’ll get strange looks from strangers but to be honest it’s better both for the dog and for any stranger that you happen upon. A LOT cheaper than a potential lawsuit from a dog bite. It doesn’t sit too tightly on the dogs face. Make sure to get accurate measurements though!
customer_reviews.author: Nachos and Lemonheads on My Dad’s Boat

customer_reviews.title: Good muzzle. Wish they made a smaller size.
customer_reviews.text: I use these basket muzzles to help my patients have a more fear free experience. You can give the pets treats easily with them on and it allows them to pant. Just wish they made a size to fit toy breeds. This seems something size is ok for a dachshund but won't fit a chihuahua.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Does the job for my dogs!!
customer_reviews.text: Does it job got for my pit bull and bull mastiff and one for pit fits perfect. But bull mastiffs has to be put on very tightly so they can’t get it off and with doing that it pushes underneath the eyes and leaves red marks so I would not leave on for long time. It definitely does the job. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHANIE WOOLFORD

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer
customer_reviews.text: I am fostering a dog who is reactive to people at times. We wanted to take him places and work on training him around new people while maintaining everyone's safety. This has changed his life. He is now able to go out in public, meet new people, and continue to improve overall. It didn't take long to muzzle train him and it seems to be comfortable overall. He is a 70+ lb american bulldog mix and we tried the 5 first, but it ended up being too big so we bought the 4 and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Marie

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edge breaks skin on muzzle ...
customer_reviews.text: Size 6 is slightly larger than Size 5, I have both ... Size 5 is suggested by vendor for standard german shepherds ... I highly recommend Size 6 which gives the dog a little more space to pant and helps prevent cutting the dog ... either way, feel for sharp edges that may injure the dog and round the edge or tape padding to the device where contact would occur ... my dog is a standard size 18 month german shepherd ...
customer_reviews.author: Ken W

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and breathable for my rescued English mastiff
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and breathable for my rescued English mastiff. He is good dog but gets scared when kids who run up to him and hug him like a teddy bear at the vet office, or when swarms people surround him in amazement of his size. So I needed a device that isn't too scary and also able to be worn for over 20 minutes. The psychological signal to strangers saying approach slowly is desired. Being previously abused and enjoying a 655 acre farm provides him comfort, free range, and solitude that he deserves. He and I enjoy our privacy. This product gives us that during the times I must take him in public like the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Rudolph

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust the chart.
customer_reviews.text: It's too big. I bought a size 3 (beagle) because my dog is a beagle/aussie mix, so bigger than the average beagle but smaller than a cattle dog. It covers her eyes. Before you ask "why didn't you measure?" She bites basically anything near her face. Hence the muzzle. I did tighten it, but the cage is still too big and it covers her face. She was able to rip it off in about 10 minutes. It might work better for walks when she is not distracted.
customer_reviews.author: Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I followed all measurement instructions, and the size 5 was way to short for my GSD. I cannot imagine getting the larger size and it being secure at all. His nose is touching the front and if I left it on him, it's so loose around the muzzle that he would eventually rip it off over his head. Too much leeway in the widest part, so there is nothing to keep your dog's nose from traveling forward to the end.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working so far...
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a rescue a couple months ago that has bitten he several times so I was afraid to bathe him. I started loosely putting the muzzle on him after smearing peanut butter inside. He progressed quickly to letting me secure it. Bathe time was easy with a generous helping of peanut butter. The muzzle seems well made, it's easy to clean, and it l doesn't seem too uncomfortable for my little guy.
customer_reviews.author: AverageJane

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used it about 10 times all together and 1 time for a 2 mile hike and he did great. Zeus loves women, children, and other animals but doesn’t like some big men so this muzzle has been great!! Zeus is a 6yr old American Bulldog, we got the size 6 and it fits perfect. Don’t forget to feed the muzzle through the collar so it says on.
customer_reviews.author: Momof31982

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw in this version
customer_reviews.text: The design has changed since the first one I bought pertaining to the top strap between the ears. It used to be a strap that looped through and adjusted like a watch strap. The ones I bough recently had the strap looped through, knotted and fused. The seam slips around with upward pressure and rubs a raw spot on the dog's snout. There is not apparent way to relieve this. So I'm going to return the ones I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Debra H

customer_reviews.title: Didn't think I would need it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 1.5 yr old GSD to take him to the vet, he's socialized with my 5 other dogs but strange dogs are unknown ... needed it when he turned on my 30 lb instigating little brat of a dog, little dog will snap at other dogs and bite their legs, etc ... GSD decided enough was enough, unfortunately 80 lbs vs 30 lbs isn't fair and GSD now wears the muzzle, little dog is being severely monitored ...
customer_reviews.author: CNYSarge

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase. Got it before I needed it.
customer_reviews.text: Not something that I can experience first hand, but the lack of padding made me mark the comfort down. My dog was still able to get the muzzle off without the top strap. Seems a bit loose on the muzzle, but I have not attempted forming it in warm water. Overall, it being all same material makes it easy to clean, and since I don't leave it on the pup for long or without supervision it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Customer 000

customer_reviews.title: Great Muzzle, Weak clip...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our Akita. He is able to easily pant, drink and does not seem bothered by it. After 2 months of daily use I noticed the muzzle was hanging around his collar. After a closer look I found the clasp / clip had failed. We like the product but are concerned due to the clip being the single most important feature. if the clip fails...the muzzle can come off....if the muzzle comes off without someone knowing...someone could be bitten....bad news. If the clip was stronger I would rate this as a 5 star in all categories.
customer_reviews.author: Gillette

customer_reviews.title: Inside edges are very sharp
customer_reviews.text: I really like this muzzle, but as others said, the edges of the inside are very sharp and I also had to whittle with a knife. It is strange that outer muzzle edges are nicely rounded (for what reason?) but inside is not. I really hope that they get that part right some day. Especially the top part rubs against above the top of the dog's nose (between the nose and the forehead area). Other than that, it's really a nice design. I would even pay $30 or more if the inside edges came rounded.
customer_reviews.author: Aiko

customer_reviews.title: It’s great!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before buying this for my dog. I really wanted something to be comfortable for him. He typically doesn’t have to wear it but when I put it on, he doesn’t struggle. He, of course, tried pawing it off but it’s very secure to his head. He can eat snacks with it on, haven’t tried water; I’m sure it wouldn’t be a problem. My vet gave me props, that’s also how I know I made a good purchase. My pup deserves nothing but the best!
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: Size 1 is too big for small, adult Pomeranians
customer_reviews.text: A size 1 does not fit a small adult Pomeranian between 6 to 8 lbs. I tried it on both my Pomeranians. One has a wide, short snout (teddy bear face), while the other has a narrow, long snout (fox face). They were able to quickly paw the muzzle off because of the poor fit. I think I made the mistake of buying this twice because I forgot, so I decided to leave a review. But the seller was great at providing a refund. I didn't have to return the item either, which was nice since it's a hassle to return stuff. I wish they made this in 0 or 00.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too small, too big, missing the perfect middle!
customer_reviews.text: The concept is great, but it doesn't work. My dog is, like most dogs, mixed breed and that makes her between sizes. The size 3 is too tight and the size 4 is too large and bulky, making it not fit properly. These cage style muzzles, though they are more preventative than the mesh muzzles, do not fit many dogs due to their in-between sizes. I feel like the size 4 would be great if the opening end wasn't so large and stuff. The muzzle tip part fits relatively well, but by the opening it's too big, loose, and stiff for my dog. :( I do not recommend this if your dog, like mine, is between sizes.
customer_reviews.author: AKCChamp

customer_reviews.title: Broke. It was ok to stop chewing for about a month.
customer_reviews.text: The muzzle was ok to get my dog to stop chewing on herself and tearing up blankets, but broke after a month of using it. The top strap is just not very strong. Additionally the strap falls over in their eyes all the time being a weak material and unable to hold itself in place. I would not use this muzzle on an aggressive dog though. Would not trust the rubber on the front. If you need it to keep from tearing things up or chewing on themselves it is decent but that is all I would use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent responsive service/exchanges if initial sizing doesn’t fit.
customer_reviews.text: Traveling with ESA Labradoodle to Europe. Vet recommended I take a “mesh” muzzle like this one (because she can pant with it on if she gets nervous) just in case another passenger gets in a tiff about my sweet pup. Ordered a size too large...Baskerville was wonderful about swapping sizes...new size arrived before I was able to get the old item to the UPS store. The size 3 fits and is quite light. Well made...and, while Maggie clearly doesn't like wearing it...she also hates harnesses...it will be a comfort knowing that I have it with me “in case.”
customer_reviews.author: Doug S.

customer_reviews.title: Detail the wrong sizes
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this muzzle i ordered two , so i can train my female dogs to get alomg agian. They had one fight, but i needed to teach the younger one to give my older one more space. And i ordered for a rottie and a lab. Size 5. And it was way to big Im i dont know if i can return it i wish i could. But the sizes definitely need to be re done on the details. And size icons. Im going to try with a 4 and 3 now. And i have full breeds also.
customer_reviews.author: rebekkah richards

customer_reviews.title: Inhumane and not secure
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible design. The dog can't not open its' mouth which is very important as that is how they cool off, by panting. There is also nothing to secure it from the bottom so as it stretches, the dog is able to remove the mask by merely pushing upwards with its' paws. Bought 2 of these, one for my Great Dane and one for my Lab and both escaped within 45 seconds and that was after i tightened them down.
customer_reviews.author: Seanmc12

product_meta.title: Baskerville Ultra Muzzle
product_meta.description: Size:5 - Labrador| Color:BlackDogs can wear muzzles for many different reasons. Whether for the careful socialization of a new rescue dog, general handling or to safely manage aggression, it is important that the dog is happy and secure wearing a muzzle. Dr. Roger Mugford developed the patented Baskerville Ultra Muzzle to provide an optimal muzzle fit for all dogs, including shorter nose breeds such as Boxers. The Ultra Muzzle perfectly combines comfort for the dog and owner peace of mind. The Baskerville Ultra muzzle is designed to guarantee a dog’s welfare by allowing panting and drinking at all times.
feature_bullets: SOFT & LIGHTWEIGHT rubber basket design gives all-around mouth protection allowing canines unrestricted eating, drinking and panting while preventing biting. Used for safe socialization, safe handling during vet visits, grooming or dog travelling.

SAFE & SECURE ergonomically designed safety strapping ensures muzzle will remain securely in place and features two attachment points using an attachment loop designed to attach to your dog’s regular collar and an optional, removable over-head safety strap
ADJUSTABLE & COMFORTABLE Neoprene padded lining for added comfort and fully adjustable neck and head straps with pre-holed webbing for a quick and secure fit.
DOG FRIENDLY – allows canines to drink, pant and be rewarded and treated. Perfect for daily dog exercise and walks

EXTREMELY TOUGH AND DURABLE made of a malleable thermal plastic rubber which can be heated and shaped for a personalized tailored fit around dog’s snout, including broad nosed dogs. Gives all around protection for biting or snappy dogs.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
